issue.title: Abstract classes should not be VariableTypes

discussion.p: Since one cannot create an instance of an abstract class, an abstract class type T should not have an implicitly-defined concept map VariableType<T>.

ol.li: Requires: for every type T that is an object type or reference type, but not an abstract class type ([class.abstract]), a concept map VariableType<T> shall be implicitly defined in namespace std.
